message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $110. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it.
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. I'm looking to save as much as I can, and $90 is my maximum budget for this product.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that you're looking to save some money, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer you the product for $100. It's a great compromise that still benefits both of us.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $95. I'm really interested in the product, but I need to make sure it fits within my budget.

I understand your concern about the budget, Bob. However, I'm still a bit far from your target price. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer you the product for $98. It's a fair price that still reflects the value of the product, but I'm willing to make a slight adjustment to meet you in the middle.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $97, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. I really want to make this deal happen, but I need to stay within my budget.

I understand that you're willing to meet me at $97, Bob, but I'm not sure I can go that low. I've already compromised a lot, and I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price for the product. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I can offer you the product for $99. It's a fair price, and I think it's a good compromise.

I understand that you've made some concessions, Alice, but I'm still not willing to go above $97. I'm willing to make a deal at this price, but I need you to meet me at this point. If not, I'll have to consider buying from John for $120.
